Office of the Mayor
===================

![Escobar](https://princetontx.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=6966)
Welcome to Princeton, Texas, where small-town charm meets modern convenience in the Lone Star State! Located between McKinney and Greenville, Princeton is currently the third fastest-growing city in the country. We’re thrilled you’ve chosen to call Princeton your home!

Our City has seen rapid expansion in recent years, and we’re committed to ensuring responsible growth while preserving our charm and tight-knit community. From annual festivals and neighborhood gatherings to library events and resident academies, we offer a wide range of engagement opportunities to bring our community together.

On behalf of myself, our City Council, and our staff, welcome to the City of Princeton!

Eugene Escobar, Jr., Honorable Mayor
[Email Eugene Escobar](mailto:eescobar@princetontx.us)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Eugene Escobar Jr. serves as the Mayor of Princeton, Texas, providing leadership during a period of continued growth and long-term planning for the community. A resident of Princeton since 2013, Mayor Escobar and his wife have made the city their home while raising their family, and he brings a strong personal connection to the community he serves.

Mayor Escobar has more than 15 years of professional experience in information technology, business management, and organizational leadership. His background includes overseeing multi-state operations, supporting business development, and helping organizations improve efficiency and long-range planning. This experience informs his approach to municipal governance, with an emphasis on strategic thinking, collaboration, and responsible decision-making.

As Mayor, Escobar’s priorities focus on preserving Princeton as a family-friendly community while supporting growth that enhances the city’s overall quality of life. He supports thoughtful land-use planning, infrastructure investment, and community amenities that contribute to safe neighborhoods, accessible parks, and a strong sense of place for residents. Ensuring that growth is balanced with available services and infrastructure remains an important consideration in his leadership.

Public safety is a central focus of Mayor Escobar’s work. He collaborates closely with the City Council, city management, and public safety departments to support the continued development of police, fire, and emergency response services. His goal is to ensure these essential services are well-positioned to meet both current needs and future demands as Princeton continues to grow.

Mayor Escobar is committed to transparent governance, fiscal responsibility, and open communication with residents. Through collaboration with elected officials, city staff, and community stakeholders, he seeks to advance policies and initiatives that support Princeton’s long-term sustainability and maintain a high quality of life for residents today and in the future.
